Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.hostconfiguration

Class HostConfiguration

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.hostconfiguration.HostConfiguration
public final class HostConfiguration extends Object
Defines all Servers used in the GMP distributed memory parallel cluster. Each machine is defined within an internal Machine class. A map of all host names associated with their Machine class is maintained for inspection and manipulation.
Author:
jrhipp

    • getParameter

      public String getParameter(String hostname, HostConfiguration.HostConfigurationCategory hcc)
      Returns the parameter value (as a string) from the input host for the parameter defined by the input enum HostConfigurationCategory.
      Parameters:
      hostname - The host name for which the parameter value will be returned.
      hcc - The HostConfigurationCategory defining the parameter to be returned.
      Returns:
      The parameter value (as a string) from the input host for the parameter defined by the input enum HostConfigurationCategory.

    • dumpHostMachineInfo

      public String dumpHostMachineInfo(String hdr, int colSpc)
      Returns a string table of all host machine information.
      Parameters:
      hdr - A header appended to every line.
      colSpc - The inter-column spacing.
      Returns:
      A string table of all host machine information.

    • orderedMachineList

      public ArrayList<HostConfiguration.Machine> orderedMachineList()
      Returns an ordered list of all machines in the GMP distributed memory cluster. The list is ordered first by machine development history, then by number of cores, then by CPU cycle speed, then by total available memory, and finally by host name.
      Returns:
      An ordered list of all machines in the GMP distributed memory cluster.

    • toString

      public String toString(String hdr, String category, HashMap<String,HashSet<HostConfiguration.Machine>> machineMap)
      Outputs a string table of machine types ordered by the input hash map. The hash map contains a set of host entries for some key (e.g. Xeon number).
      Parameters:
      hdr - The header appended to every line ouput.
      category - The input maps category name (used as a title).
      machineMap - The input map that will be output.
      Returns:
      A string table of machine types ordered by the input hash map. The hash map contains a set of host entries for some key (e.g. Xeon number).
